page.title: 02HAMBLEDON HILL NEAR SHROTON
page.content: THE MOST DISTINCTIVE FEATURE OF THIS AREA IS A LONG RIDGE OF CHALK DOWNLAND WHICH IS FASCINATING TO THOSE WHO TAKE WALKS ON IT TO EXERCISE THEIR DOGS AND LOOK AT THE VIEWS OF BEAUTIFUL DORSET COUNTRYSIDE, AND ALSO IS A VERY HISTORIC PLACE. THESE ARE NOT THE ONLY MARVELS OF THE HILL. IT IS GREAT FUN TO CLIMB. ON ONE OF THE RAMPARTS IS AN OLD TREE STUMP WHICH LOOKS VERY MUCH LIKE A MAN HOLDING A PAIR OF BINOCULARS, WHEN SEEN FROM A DISTANCE. CATTLE GRAZE FREELY BUT LOOK OUT FOR THE OCCASIONAL BULL. IF YOU EVER DECIDE TO HAVE A PICNIC THERE HANG ONTO YOUR PAPER TABLENAPKINS AS THEY WILL BLOW ALL OVER THE PLACE. IT IS BEST TO EAT SITTING BETWEEN THE RAMPARTS AS THE WIND IS VERY STRONG EVEN ON A HOT DAY.
